commit_message:
WSMAN enumerate fails to return all entries

When querying an enumeration using the WSMAN enumerate method, not all
entries are returned if there are more than max_elems (default of 100)
in the enumeration.

When querying an enumeration, the first response returns <wsman:Items>
in the body.  Successive pulls, however, contain <wsen:Items>.

The old code always queried for <wsen:Items>, which caused the first
batch of attributes to be dropped only when the number of entries in
the enumeration exceeded max_elems.

This patch queries for <wsman:Items> in the first response, and for
<wsen:Items> in successive responses.

Change-Id: I2e9036b562c7d7ba5af188dd552b6c67388bb02c
Closes-Bug: #1659052

added_lines: As an administrator, I would like to be able to run an action plan that willThis specification defines two different planners with the same input/outputtheir weights. High weight actions will be planned before the low weight ones. Parallelization is the availability to execute several actions, with the same action type, in parallel. Parallelization factor is limited by another taskflow parameter named max_worker. Administrator can specify each action type's weight and its parallelization ability in the watcher configuration file.New configuration parameters in watcher.conf: [watcher_planner] planner = weight #planner = workload_stabilization [watcher_planners.weight] #weights = turn_host_to_acpi_s3_state:10,resize:20,migrate:30,sleep:40, change_nova_service_state:50,nop:60 #parallelization = turn_host_to_acpi_s3_state:2,resize:2,migrate:2,sleep:1, change_nova_service_state:1,nop:1 [watcher_planners.workload_stabilization] #weights = turn_host_to_acpi_s3_state:10,resize:20,migrate:30,sleep:40, change_nova_service_state:50,nop:60We will have 2 new planner extensions. We should reinstall properly watcher by running pip install [-e].

commit_message:
Fix double call to "qemu-img create"

Introduced by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/147186,
and unit tests didn't notice (integrated gate testing too)
We noticed this in Virtuozzo Storage CI, as it requires
backing_fmt to be defined when snapshot is created,
because otherwise it accesses backing file, which could
be held by Qemu and not available (our storage doesn't
allow simultaneous open from different mountpoints)

Change-Id: I9adcc57ffc79548872e7a5c5b0935a2cb4a2dea7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/39/425739/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Replace yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Avoid dangerous file parsing and object serialization libraries.
yaml.load is the obvious function to use but it is dangerous[1]
Because yaml.load return Python object may be dangerous if you
receive a YAML document from an untrusted source such as the
Internet. The function yaml.safe_load limits this ability to
simple Python objects like integers or lists.

In addition, Bandit flags yaml.load() as security risk so replace
all occurrences with yaml.safe_load(). Thus I replace yaml.load()
with yaml.safe_load()

[1]https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: Ifaecff145e91f72911ae05ea274a4977c56212c7
Closes-Bug: #1634265

added_lines: return yaml.safe_load(open(yaml_file))

subject: Use UUID instead of "00000" for UniqueId
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-27 05:35:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/magnum/commit/f872449ed092b9230ea66af23329a033f1d4f4e4', 'message': 'Use UUID instead of "00000" for UniqueId

The swarm bay should pass specified "UniqueId" to the resource of
OS::Heat::WaitConditionHandle, but the "UniqueId" is "00000" in
the templates of swarm. So let's use UUID instead of "00000".

commit_message:
Use UUID instead of "00000" for UniqueId

The swarm bay should pass specified "UniqueId" to the resource of
OS::Heat::WaitConditionHandle, but the "UniqueId" is "00000" in
the templates of swarm. So let's use UUID instead of "00000".
In addition, "UniqueID" seems to be obsolete, Use "Id" instead.

Change-Id: I86739db4a2e6faf93d55fe4998bada110de118c6
Closes-Bug: #1606486

commit_message:
[Devstack] Set DEFAULT_IMAGE_NAME variable

The logic of setting DEFAULT_IMAGE_NAME was moved to ironic
devstack plugin but original variable DEFAULT_IMAGE_NAME is
not set, while it is used by grenade.
This patch fixes setting DEFAULT_IMAGE_NAME in ironic devstack
plugin.

Change-Id: I245ca8acba14b550efe355e8a3afc8c81cdc4a23
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/99/425599/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #NOTE(vsaienko) set DEFAULT_IMAGE_NAME here, as it is still used by grenade https://github.com/openstack-dev/grenade/blob/90c4ead2f2a7ed48c873c51cef415b83d655752e/projects/60_nova/resources.sh#L31 DEFAULT_IMAGE_NAME=$IRONIC_IMAGE_NAME

commit_message:
Create deliverables.yaml

Following ML thread, voting and decision
(http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-January/110805.html)
we are adding file that will be list of all kolla deliverables. To add
new deliverable please edit this file, merge requires 2*+2 and with PTL
vote.

Change-Id: If8788c561696c27d20073af8eb94371ac6eb035d

commit_message:
Switch to decorators.idempotent_id

test.idempotent_id is being kept temporary to migrate
to new lib interface. Now idempotent_id is available as Tempest stable
interface decorators and all plugins tests using the old decorator
should be switched to new interface.

In future, Once all plugins are switched to new decorator Tempest
will remove the test.idempotent_id

Change-Id: I20ef363a008b1c01652015cc2ada69777b8859d9
Related-Bug: 1616913

commit_message:
Enable domain specific drivers

Enable support for domain specific drivers, managed via
configuration files (instead of directly using the API and
database).

Using multiple domains means that calls to users.list must
be scoped to a specific domain; ensure that v3 calls to this
method are appropriately scoped.

Change-Id: I7ed84b7210597ab1633eba343a0c68741a5a8578
Partial-Bug: 1645803

commit_message:
Added Cinder storage pools data

This change adds the cinder storage pools data to the influx metric
collection system as a plugin.

commit_message:
Add script for unit test coverage job

This commit will add script and coverage config file that will allow to run
non voting coverage job which will detect any changes in the code coverage
for each commit on review.

Change-Id: I624d1228df0adf1f34a498e5e86b6b092e667f5f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/81/417881/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {toxinidir}/tools/cover.sh {posargs}

commit_message:
Add support for BGPVPN plugin

  Introduce puppet classes to configure networking-bgpvpn service
  plugin

Implements: blueprint bgpvpn-service-integration

Change-Id: I317f3cc05381889a315a5886a1d49ebba8756482
Signed-off-by: Ricardo Noriega <rnoriega@redhat.com>

'}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2017-01-04 00:22:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_neutron/commit/195eb69fceed1a6e4fed01c469b2392da03342f2', 'message': 'Implementation Neutron SR-IOV

This change implements SR-IOV support inside Neutron via
the new ``ml2.sriov`` plugin.
The current implementation automatically configures the ML2
mechanism drivers via the enabled neutron_plugins and
configured mechanisms attribute inside the dictionary.
The implementation is based off the neutron-sriov-nic-agent
and configures physical device mappings over a new
attribute ``sriov_host_interface`` as part of the
provider_networks configuration.
Additionally the FDB agent inside the ``linuxbridge_agent.ini``
is enabled to support the linuxbridge and sriov-nic-agent on the
same interface.

Closes-Bug: #1653283

Co-Authored-By: James Denton <james.denton@rackspace.com>

Change-Id: I7b580db0496ff009a2f64c71447b2977f22d6bf6

commit_message:
Implementation Neutron SR-IOV

This change implements SR-IOV support inside Neutron via
the new ``ml2.sriov`` plugin.
The current implementation automatically configures the ML2
mechanism drivers via the enabled neutron_plugins and
configured mechanisms attribute inside the dictionary.
The implementation is based off the neutron-sriov-nic-agent
and configures physical device mappings over a new
attribute ``sriov_host_interface`` as part of the
provider_networks configuration.
Additionally the FDB agent inside the ``linuxbridge_agent.ini``
is enabled to support the linuxbridge and sriov-nic-agent on the
same interface.

Closes-Bug: #1653283

Co-Authored-By: James Denton <james.denton@rackspace.com>

Change-Id: I7b580db0496ff009a2f64c71447b2977f22d6bf6
Depends-On: Ia62725e2369f75000157e0ab2c3f858e61fef10d
Implements: sriov support
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_neutron refs/changes/03/415903/14 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: mechanisms: "linuxbridge{% if neutron_l2_population | bool %},l2population{% endif %}{% if neutron_sriov | bool %},sriovnicswitch{% endif %}" neutron-sriov-agent: group: neutron_sriov_agent service_name: neutron-sriov-nic-agent service_en: "{{ neutron_sriov | bool }}" service_conf_path: "{{ neutron_conf_dir }}" service_conf: plugins/ml2/sriov_agent.ini config_options: "--config-file {{ neutron_conf_dir }}/neutron.conf --config-file {{ neutron_conf_dir }}/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini --config-file {{ neutron_conf_dir }}/plugins/ml2/sriov_agent.ini --log-file=/var/log/neutron/neutron-sriov-nic-agent.log" config_overrides: "{{ neutron_sriov_agent_ini_overrides }}" config_type: "ini"# Enable or disable SRIOV. neutron_sriov: false neutron_sriov_agent_ini_overrides: {}

subject: add note when using OS_AUTH_TYPE
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-25 19:49:31.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/shell.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-gnocchiclient/commit/6c32b7b4928b8032da2c807b3b0c92bf0943ed47', 'message': 'add note when using OS_AUTH_TYPE

OS_AUTH_TYPE is shared globally by clients so add a note to make
users aware

Change-Id: I1a208077777730ba0c74a3e047199ac29f8aed47
'}]
commit_message:
add note when using OS_AUTH_TYPE

OS_AUTH_TYPE is shared globally by clients so add a note to make
users aware

Change-Id: I1a208077777730ba0c74a3e047199ac29f8aed47

commit_message:
Add control_exchange and rpc_response_timeout options

Add control_exchange to configure an exchange name for message.
Add rpc_response_timeout to configure seconds time for waiting
for a response from a call.

Change-Id: I255c4ceda252f0f39eecc823cef2820c9e7b1e48

commit_message:
Fix security group creation

When using init-runonce script multiple default
security groups are present and raise error:
More than one security_group exists with the name 'default'.

Add a check to create rules to admin's default sec group.

Change-Id: Iaf93467d70ae41fdbcd2b37d6c5639a32d939394
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/90/424690/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Get admin user and tenant IDs ADMIN_USER_ID=$(openstack user list | awk '/ admin / {print $2}') ADMIN_PROJECT_ID=$(openstack project list | awk '/ admin / {print $2}') ADMIN_SEC_GROUP=$(openstack security group list --project ${ADMIN_PROJECT_ID} | awk '/ default / {print $2}') --protocol icmp ${ADMIN_SEC_GROUP} --protocol tcp --dst-port 22 ${ADMIN_SEC_GROUP} --protocol tcp --dst-port 8000 ${ADMIN_SEC_GROUP} --protocol tcp --dst-port 8080 ${ADMIN_SEC_GROUP}
deleted_lines: --protocol icmp default --protocol tcp --dst-port 22 default --protocol tcp --dst-port 8000 default --protocol tcp --dst-port 8080 default# Get admin user and tenant IDs ADMIN_USER_ID=$(openstack user list | awk '/ admin / {print $2}') ADMIN_PROJECT_ID=$(openstack project list | awk '/ admin / {print $2}')

commit_message:
Improve pipeline/Async logging

Currently events are grouped by K8s object's UID and that grouping
key is used for logging in Async handler.

This patch changes grouping key to K8s object's 'selfLink' to help
with log readability. It has no impact on functionality since
'selfLink' is as unique as UID as far as Kuryr is concerned.

Change-Id: Ie903f64d181723d5db0f59dcdf282f5a206879a3
Partially-Implements: blueprint kuryr-k8s-integration

subject: Track failures during sorting of test results
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-10 18:27:53.000000000', 'files': ['os_testr/subunit2html.py', 'os_testr/tests/test_subunit2html.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-testr/commit/b296846535ab7df1d1fd1136db757dd1196c96cb', 'message': "Track failures during sorting of test results

The current logic only considers the first occurrence of a test class
and doesn't update a class's pass/fail status after that. So a test
class, for example:

 TestClass
   test_1 pass
   test_2 fail
   test_3 pass

is counted as a passing test class even though it has a failure.

This adds failure tracking to the test result sorting so that any
failure in a test class will make it considered a failing test class
and be sorted at the top of the HTML result page.

Closes-Bug: #1640889

Change-Id: I06919336a09c4afda8ec3a9e7d64d305fbd169c3
"}]
commit_message:
Track failures during sorting of test results

The current logic only considers the first occurrence of a test class
and doesn't update a class's pass/fail status after that. So a test
class, for example:

 TestClass
   test_1 pass
   test_2 fail
   test_3 pass

is counted as a passing test class even though it has a failure.

This adds failure tracking to the test result sorting so that any
failure in a test class will make it considered a failing test class
and be sorted at the top of the HTML result page.

Closes-Bug: #1640889

Change-Id: I06919336a09c4afda8ec3a9e7d64d305fbd169c3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-testr refs/changes/50/396350/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix typo and change regexp to regex

This commit fixes some typos and changes 'regexp' to 'regex'. I think
'regexp' is also correct. However, in ostestr, they are mixed. So users
may be confused with it. So let's fix it.

Change-Id: I6c9042527707315f5dbb56f4a406327668c57d04

commit_message:
Allow diskless nodes introspection

There is a demand to use introspection on diskless nodes to figure out
what is possible to figure out.

We might need more changes to properly support diskless nodes, this
change is just to allow people to play with it.

The property ``local_gb == 0`` for a diskless node.

Change-Id: I21b2f2c069fdbf767367ec3d1fbf77bab6292b25
Partial-Bug: #1554243

commit_message:
Correct ringbuilder's set_weight usage string

The large version of the set_weight usage is missing the
new weight value. This has lead to confusion on the mailing
list.

This patch adds a <new_weight> option to not only add the
missing argument but also to make the command more clear
by differentiate between the search weight (--weight) and
how to set the new.

Change-Id: I7a4c5a6a4438f647fa33d65e22d1863c27d345be
Closes-Bug: #1660214
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/20/426620/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: swift-ring-builder <builder_file> set_weight <search-value> <new_weight> [<search-value> <new_weight] ... --device <device_name> --meta <meta> --weight <weight> <new_weight> and port. <weight> and <new_weight> are the search weight and new weight values respectively.

commit_message:
v1 execution plan template processing was fixed

In v1 execution plans Scripts section must contain a list
of base64-encoded files. But instead of a file content,
the file path was encoded.

Change-Id: Ibb45de6dd2895a308000d083e0603020502d3b0d
Closes-Bug: #1657839

commit_message:
Fix data display when listing resources

The list of columns is currently hardcoded and does not take into account extra
columns returned when using the `--details` option. This build a dynamic column
list in all cases.

It also hides the (deprecated) fields `created_by_*` if `creator` is present.
It also hides the `metrics` field in most cases (except show) as it's usually
big and make the list very long in some cases.

Change-Id: Id25e9f30189cb7faccf3f4b9adb4df413435296c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-gnocchiclient refs/changes/59/425759/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _list2cols(self, resources): """Return a formatted list of resources.""" if not resources: return cols = list(self.COLS) for k in resources[0]: if k not in cols: cols.append(k) if 'creator' in cols: cols.remove('created_by_user_id') cols.remove('created_by_project_id') return utils.list2cols(cols, resources) # Do not dump metrics because it makes the list way too long for r in resources: del r['metrics'] return self._list2cols(resources) if parsed_args.formatter == 'table': return self._list2cols(map(normalize_metrics, resources)) return self._list2cols(resources) # Do not dump metrics because it makes the list way too long for r in resources: del r['metrics'] return self._list2cols(resources)
deleted_lines: return utils.list2cols(self.COLS, resources) cols = resources[0].keys() if resources else self.COLS if parsed_args.formatter == 'table': return utils.list2cols(cols, map(normalize_metrics, resources)) return utils.list2cols(cols, resources) return utils.list2cols(self.COLS, resources)

commit_message:
Remove unneeded oraclelinux-extras.repo

This is failing locally for me with 'Cannot find a valid baseurl for
repo: extras/x86_64'

It was originally added to allow magnum to build, though it appears to
be building ok without now.

Change-Id: Ic6cf4d512e966ba34035c37a5805916b20715ed0

commit_message:
Switch to decorators.idempotent_id

test.idempotent_id is being kept temporary to migrate
to new lib interface. Now idempotent_id is available as Tempest stable
interface decorators and all plugins tests using the old decorator
should be switched to new interface.

In future, Once all plugins are switched to new decorator Tempest
will remove the test.idempotent_id

Change-Id: I993fcd22070dca995fb2fb59e876230e8fd0df9e
Related-Bug: 1616913

commit_message:
Remove subnetpool_id tag for Neutron existing subnet

Since we adds subnetpool tag for existing subnet, we
should remove it when doing ReleasePool operation.

Change-Id: I0b63540b4410c9feb38fbdd8f88bda5e598bb016
Closes-Bug: #1656160
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-libnetwork refs/changes/35/419735/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _neutron_subnet_remove_tag(subnetid, tag): app.neutron.remove_tag('subnets', subnetid, tag) # Remove subnetpool_id tag from Neutron existing subnet. pools = _get_subnetpools_by_attrs(id=pool_id) if pools: pool = pools[0] prefixes = pool['prefixes'] if len(prefixes) > 1: app.logger.warning(_LW("More than one prefixes present. Picking " "first one.")) for prefix in prefixes: subnet_cidr = ipaddress.ip_network(six.text_type(prefix)) break else: raise exceptions.NoResourceException( "No subnetpools with id {0} is found." .format(pool_id)) subnets_by_cidr = _get_subnets_by_attrs(cidr=six.text_type(subnet_cidr)) if subnets_by_cidr: for tmp_subnet in subnets_by_cidr: if tmp_subnet.get('tags') is not None: if pool_id in tmp_subnet.get('tags'): _neutron_subnet_remove_tag(tmp_subnet['id'], pool_id) break

commit_message:
Stop accepting 1 return code for cell_v2_map_cell0

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/420132/ has merged, so Nova now returns
0 and we don't need to accept 1 return code, which was a workaround.

Cleanup this workaround and so the exec will fail Nova sends 1 return
code.

Change-Id: I530ea2631cec7d49f2a4f68f0fec3eae0b45ad88
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/81/426581/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Postpone deprecation warnings to Pike

2.12.0 added a DeprecationWarning a bit late in
Ocata for other projects to react properly. For example
Neutron logs get filled up pretty badly. So let's
defer the deprecation warnings for one more release

Note f25543fcc792ebf155728a91fde06e8dc4e96cea adds
the warning(s).

Instead of a full revert, let's just key off of a
variable _log_deprecation_warnings both in context.py
and test_context.py with a FIXME reminder

Closes-Bug: #1660088

Change-Id: I45ba9a0ed628f3347c7c3b346e907e4363452dd8

This patch adds the functionality to support image_driver
during container create/run. If user provides a valid image_driver,
that is defined in configuration he/she will be allowed to create

add image_driver field in db, so that user can inspect which image

commit_message:
Support to provide 'image_driver' during container create

This patch adds the functionality to support image_driver
during container create/run. If user provides a valid image_driver,
that is defined in configuration he/she will be allowed to create
the container otherwise the request will fail. This patch also
add image_driver field in db, so that user can inspect which image
driver he/she used during the container create.

Partially-Implements: BP allow-specify-image-driver
Change-Id: Id2299a613ed414b2df67c103fe6cda0397ab791d

subject: Changes image creation/deletion in sanity_check to be atomic..
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-24 23:03:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/murano-dashboard/commit/a5ac80561e83e4cafa4443659d64b7fb5d021736', 'message': '[WIP] Fixes image deletion in sanity_check to fail many tests.

Image creation and deletion is done at the class level in
ImageTestCase. Also, in TestSuiteImage self.repair_image() is
called which basically restores the deleted class-level image
through the UI. This has a couple vulnerabilities:
 - self.repair_image is not called via self.addCleanup
 - self.repair_image is done via UI -- this is kludgey
 - self.image.id is used in many different classes that inherit
   from ImageTestCase -- meaning if self.image is deleted many
   tests in even other test suites can fail.

This patch changes self.image to be test-level, created in
setUp instead of setUpClass and deleted in tearDown instead
of tearDownClass.

Change-Id: I0c8628c7fdf182cc512c16faa30f1dd763b8f08e
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-25 18:06:46.000000000', 'files': ['muranodashboard/tests/functional/sanity_check.py', 'muranodashboard/tests/functional/base.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/murano-dashboard/commit/3bf38434fecdaba29761e92a5bbb8c149c3cdb02', 'message': 'Changes image creation/deletion in sanity_check to be atomic..

Right now, image creation/deletion is done at the class level in
ImageTestCase. Also, in TestSuiteImage relies on self.repair_image
to clean up the class-level image through the UI. This has
several potential points of failure:

 - self.repair_image is not called via self.addCleanup:
   if the test fails before repair_image is called, the image
   is not restored.
 - self.repair_image is done via UI: this can obviously fail,
   because Selenium should never be used to reliably clean up
   a resource.
 - self.image.id is used in many different classes that inherit
   from ImageTestCase: this can result in failures in other
   test suites.

This patch changes self.image to be test-level, created in
setUp instead of setUpClass and deleted in tearDown instead
of tearDownClass.

This is an example of a log that shows multiple tests failing
across different test suites because the class-level image
(probably) was already deleted and thus not found:

https://murano-ci.mirantis.com/logs/25/424525/1/check/gate-murano-dashboard-ubuntu/ca45725/

Change-Id: I0c8628c7fdf182cc512c16faa30f1dd763b8f08e
'}]
commit_message:
Changes image creation/deletion in sanity_check to be atomic..

Right now, image creation/deletion is done at the class level in
ImageTestCase. Also, in TestSuiteImage relies on self.repair_image
to clean up the class-level image through the UI. This has
several potential points of failure:

 - self.repair_image is not called via self.addCleanup:
   if the test fails before repair_image is called, the image
   is not restored.
 - self.repair_image is done via UI: this can obviously fail,
   because Selenium should never be used to reliably clean up
   a resource.
 - self.image.id is used in many different classes that inherit
   from ImageTestCase: this can result in failures in other
   test suites.

This patch changes self.image to be test-level, created in
setUp instead of setUpClass and deleted in tearDown instead
of tearDownClass.

This is an example of a log that shows multiple tests failing
across different test suites because the class-level image
(probably) was already deleted and thus not found:

https://murano-ci.mirantis.com/logs/25/424525/1/check/gate-murano-dashboard-ubuntu/ca45725/

Change-Id: I0c8628c7fdf182cc512c16faa30f1dd763b8f08e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano-dashboard refs/changes/91/424891/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def setUp(self): super(ImageTestCase, self).setUp() self.image_title = self.gen_random_resource_name('test-image', 15) self.image = self.upload_image(self.image_title) def tearDown(self): super(ImageTestCase, self).tearDown() self.glance.images.delete(self.image.id)
deleted_lines: cls.image_title = 'New Image ' + str(time.time()) cls.image = cls.upload_image(cls.image_title) @classmethod def tearDownClass(cls): super(ImageTestCase, cls).tearDownClass() cls.glance.images.delete(cls.image.id) def repair_image(self): self.driver.find_element_by_id( 'marked_images__action_mark_image').click() self.select_from_list('image', self.image.id) self.fill_field(by.By.ID, 'id_title', self.image_title) self.select_from_list('type', 'linux') self.select_and_click_element('Mark Image') self.check_element_on_page(by.By.XPATH, consts.TestImage.format(self.image_title))

commit_message:
gnocchi: don't rely on gnocchi uuid5

This change adds support for the new information within
the UnknownResource exception. This allows to remove usage of gnocchi
uuid5.

Change-Id: I19900f1fda929c4f537a7dee566ad0847c076204
Depends-On: I7b631d17c879b9cd5e56fa8e06b61d5348a182d5

commit_message:
conf: fix N313 hacking check

This patch fixes hacking check N313.
Fixed regex that was causing this check not to be run.
Refactored check to be more readable.
It was lacking unit test coverage. Fixed.

Change-Id: I0693e1d1678d88634ece5ef20b97f3869ec26418
Implements: blueprint centralize-config-options-ocata
Closes-Bug: #1649297

commit_message:
Support to delete instance from network topology view

When try to delete an instance in network topology view, horizon would
try to load project/instance table in background, then do the delete
row action to the instance.
But the project instance table was paginated, it only load the first
page instances. The delete action would not work if you try to delete
an instance that are not in the first page.
The patch try to fix the bug.

Change-Id: I317bd1ee418d19c075ae3ac8d39563a0514b1795
Closes-Bug: #1597677

commit_message:
Fix MapRFS test__execute to not impact others

MapRFS test__execute_local() can fail trying ssh connect
when it is supposed to only do local tests.
The host list can be modified by other tests. So,
fix the test that modifies hosts. Make it use its own
instance of utils so it won't affect others.

Add a little more validation too.

Change-Id: I42bc2247c94490c9a0aad6c401b0fe44ccd99030
Closes-Bug: #1659162
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/32/424932/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: hosts = ['192.168.1.0', '10.10.10.10', '11.11.11.11'] self._driver._maprfs_util.hosts += hosts available_host = hosts[2] self._driver._maprfs_util._run_ssh = fake_ssh_run self._driver._maprfs_util._execute('fake', 'cmd') self.assertEqual(available_host, self._driver._maprfs_util.hosts[0])

subject: Erase only boot code in MBR during node delete
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-25 13:26:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-astute/commit/c0c4ef0fb4137f11c566ee05eb87dc09100ee794', 'message': "Erase only boot code in MBR during node delete

Zeroing first 1Mb of a block device will almost always
lead to serios system error, if there is a filesystem
on this block device and this filesystem is mounted.

This code had 2 points: to prevent system from booting
from hard drive after reboot and to prevent anaconda
(or other OS installer) to automatically recognize
disk structure. But since we only use image-based provision
this is not the case anymore.

It's enough to clear first 446 bytes of MBR where the first
stage of a bootloader resides. So we will also be able to
check nodes disks and filesystems after deleting it from
cluster for troubleshooting for example, because partition
scheme will not be touched.

https://wiki.archlinux.org/index.php/Master_Boot_Record

Change-Id: I60f2b250d6d5997b4b471c27ed00d057ae73c30a

commit_message:
Erase only boot code in MBR during node delete

Zeroing first 1Mb of a block device will almost always
lead to serios system error, if there is a filesystem
on this block device and this filesystem is mounted.

This code had 2 points: to prevent system from booting
from hard drive after reboot and to prevent anaconda
(or other OS installer) to automatically recognize
disk structure. But since we only use image-based provision
this is not the case anymore.

It's enough to clear first 446 bytes of MBR where the first
stage of a bootloader resides. So we will also be able to
check nodes disks and filesystems after deleting it from
cluster for troubleshooting for example, because partition
scheme will not be touched.

https://wiki.archlinux.org/index.php/Master_Boot_Record

Change-Id: I60f2b250d6d5997b4b471c27ed00d057ae73c30a
Fixes-bug: #1538587
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-astute refs/changes/69/297669/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: get_devices(type='all').each do |dev| # clear out the boot code in MBR system("dd if=/dev/zero of=#{dev[:name]} bs=446 count=1 oflag=direct")
deleted_lines: # Delete data disks first, then OS drive to address bug #1437511 (get_devices(type='data') + get_devices(type='root')).each do |dev| # try an make sure any ext2/3/4 paritions won't cause a panic # when the file system gets erased suppress_fs_panic(dev[:name]) # clear out the partitions of the device erase_partitions(dev[:name]) # attempt to clear our the file system data on the device partitions # to ensure that we aren't left with extra filesystem data when we # reparition the devices next time. erase_data(dev[:name]) erase_data(dev[:name], 1, dev[:size], '512') def suppress_fs_panic(dev) Dir["/dev/#{dev}{p,}[0-9]*"].each do |part| # if the partition has ext2/3/4, make sure error action is set to # continue and not panic so that we can erase it correctly. if system("blkid -p -n ext2,ext3,ext4 #{part}") == true && system("findmnt -ln -S #{part}") == true system("mount -o remount,ro,errors=continue #{part}") end end end def erase_partitions(dev) Dir["/dev/#{dev}{p,}[0-9]*"].each do |part| system("dd if=/dev/zero of=#{part} bs=1M count=10 oflag=direct") end end def erase_data(dev, length=1, offset=0, bs='1M') cmd = "dd if=/dev/zero of=/dev/#{dev} bs=#{bs} count=#{length} seek=#{offset} oflag=direct" status = system(cmd) debug_msg("Run device erasing command '#{cmd}' returned '#{status}'") status end

commit_message:
Unify haproxy prechecks condition order

Unify order on all precheck tasks to use the same.
Add the missing solum condition prchecks and keep the
location by alphabet.

Co-Authored-By: Mauricio Lima <mauriciolimab@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Francisco Edigleison Barbosa <barbosaedigleison@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: caoyuan <cao.yuan@99cloud.net>
Change-Id: I8f48cc269b0ee8092b36b310baf4680c046c53a5
Partially-implements: blueprint condition-pre-check

commit_message:
fix live gabbi test

- should be using PATCH and not default (GET) when add/delete
attributes... also should be resource_type and not resource
- seach only uses POST and not GET

Change-Id: I906ed5c7c646bcb194fa94e15e4f44df6fc2df81

commit_message:
tests: factorize measure generation to speed up test

They will all the same value unfortunately, but it should speed things up a
lot. Calling date is slow.

Change-Id: Iad7ff19528905fa16e7867fafdb662a443ab12f0

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-10 09:29:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/17e75acfae5808ebf4e3567085adf30f4b3eec0a', 'message': 'Retry on routerport race

'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-10 09:33:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/ecbbf4f48b552aea8a8d10a20cdab4c3b26f0bc4', 'message': 'Retry on routerport delete race

After deleting the router interfaces, another concurrent
process (e.g. HA port creation) could happen before the actual
router is deleted, which would lead to an SQLAlchemy error due
to the relationship being violated.

This patch fixes the issue by checking for the presents of
RouterPort records again once the delete transaction has started.
If it finds any, it will throw a retry, which will re-trigger
interface removal.

Closes-Bug: #1655281
Change-Id: I465e9a2f9b216991afa26c16271854fb88068006
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-10 11:27:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/7b82d7f495c3019d93fcb1788e41d2e7f8db04d1', 'message': 'Retry on routerport delete race

After deleting the router interfaces, another concurrent
process (e.g. HA port creation) could happen before the actual
router is deleted, which would lead to an SQLAlchemy error due
to the relationship being violated.

This patch fixes the issue by bumping the router revision before
deleting the router to check for concurrent interface additions.
A race will trigger a staledataerror which will be retried by
the decorator

Closes-Bug: #1655281
Change-Id: I465e9a2f9b216991afa26c16271854fb88068006

commit_message:
Retry on routerport delete race

After deleting the router interfaces, another concurrent
process (e.g. HA port creation) could happen before the actual
router is deleted, which would lead to an SQLAlchemy error due
to the relationship being violated.

This patch fixes the issue by bumping the router revision before
deleting the router to check for concurrent interface additions.
A race will trigger a staledataerror which will be retried by
the decorator

Closes-Bug: #1655281
Change-Id: I465e9a2f9b216991afa26c16271854fb88068006
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/81/418281/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_db import exception as db_exc # check for new ports in transaction self._throw_retry_if_ports(router) def _throw_retry_if_ports(self, context, router_db): context.session.expire(router_db, ['attached_interfaces']) if router.attached_ports.all(): raise db_exc.RetryRequest(l3.RouterInUse(router_id=router_db.id))

commit_message:
Adds support for the ironic-oneview drivers [+Docs].

This change adds support for the oneview drivers (agent, iscsi).

Note that changes on the ironic installation will occur only when
the oneview drivers are being used (agent_pxe_oneview or
iscsi_pxe_oneview are in the ironic_openstack_driver_list). This
means that this patch should not change anything on the the default
ironic installation (using agent_ipmitool driver).

Change-Id: I969df888c6a8b68e7a1a0643b46eee4b546ec13c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_ironic refs/changes/41/400241/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ironic_oneviewd_program_name: ironic-oneviewd# Set to 0 to disable erase devices on cleaning ironic_erase_devices_priority: 10 # UUID of the neutron network used for cleaning ironic_cleaning_network_uuid: "" ## ironic-oneview ironic_oneview_enabled: "{% if 'agent_pxe_oneview' in ironic_openstack_driver_list or 'agent_pxe_oneview' in ironic_standalone_driver_list or 'iscsi_pxe_oneview' in ironic_openstack_driver_list or 'iscsi_pxe_oneview' in ironic_standalone_driver_list %}True{% else %}False{% endif %}" ironic_oneview_manager_url: "" ironic_oneview_username: "" ironic_oneview_password: "" ironic_oneview_allow_insecure_connections: False ironic_oneview_tls_cacert_file: "None" ironic_oneview_max_polling_attempts: 12 # ironic-oneviewd # Polling interval in seconds for daemon to manage the nodes ironic_oneviewd_retry_interval: 30 # Size the of the RPC thread pool ironic_oneviewd_rpc_thread_pool_size: 20 # (Optional) Whether to enable the periodic tasks for OneView # driver be aware when OneView hardware resources are taken # and released by Ironic or OneView users and proactively # manage nodes in clean fail state according to Dynamic # Allocation model of hardware resources allocation in # OneView ironic_oneviewd_enable_periodic_tasks: True # Period (in seconds) for periodic tasks to be executed when # enable_periodic_tasks is True ironic_oneviewd_periodic_check_interval: "{{ ironic_oneviewd_retry_interval }}" # (Optional) Enable auditing of OneView API requests ironic_oneviewd_audit_enabled: False # Path to map file for OneView audit cases. Used only when # OneView API audit is enabled ironic_oneviewd_audit_map_file: "None" # Path to OneView audit log file. Created only when Oneview # API audit is enabled. ironic_oneviewd_audit_output_file: "None" # Ironic deploy kernel image uuid from glance ironic_oneviewd_deploy_kernel_id: "None" # Ironic deploy remdisk image uuid from glance ironic_oneviewd_deploy_ramdiskl_id: "None" # Ironic OneView driver for node create # Allowed values: iscsi_pxe_oneview, agent_pxe_oneview, fake_oneview ironic_oneviewd_ironic_driver: "agent_pxe_oneview"ironic_openstack_driver_list: - agent_ipmitool ironic_openstack_driver_loaded_list: "{% for driver in ironic_openstack_driver_list %}{{ driver }}{% if not loop.last %},{% endif %}{% endfor %}"ironic_standalone_driver_list: - agent_ipmitool ironic_standalone_driver_loaded_list: "{% for driver in ironic_standalone_driver_list %}{{ driver }}{% if not loop.last %},{% endif %}{% endfor %}"ironic_oneview_pip_packages: - ironic-oneview-cli - ironic-oneviewd ironic_ironic_oneviewd_conf_overrides: {}

commit_message:
drop api and storage references from install-guide

stop telling people how to use deprecated/unmaintained stuff
- remove all db docs detailing mongo install/config
- cleanup get_started.rst
  - remove note about future agents because i don't know what magic
    it's hinting at.
  - add note that collector is optional
- drop all notes about api service and notes about storage
- drop all stuff about configuring api with apache
- replace ceilometer+mongo config notes with ceilometer+gnocchi.
- remove keystone_authtoken config since no more api
- point all distro docs to gnocchi
- add a note to say api+storage is dead.

Change-Id: I494b4e7013ca146ffa640a356cacc4a1a5ee85e8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/04/426304/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: configure a target to send metering data to. The recommended endpoint is Gnocchi_. To enable Gnocchi, please see its install guide. .. _Gnocchi: http:/gnocchi.xyz # apt-get install ceilometer-collector \
deleted_lines: create a database, service credentials, and API endpoints. However, unlike other services, the Telemetry service uses a NoSQL database. See :ref:`environment-nosql-database-ubuntu` to install and configure MongoDB before proceeding further. 1. Create the ``ceilometer`` database: .. code-block:: console # mongo --host controller --eval ' db = db.getSiblingDB("ceilometer"); db.addUser({user: "ceilometer", pwd: "CEILOMETER_DBPASS", roles: [ "readWrite", "dbAdmin" ]})' MongoDB shell version: 2.4.x connecting to: controller:27017/test { "user" : "ceilometer", "pwd" : "72f25aeee7ad4be52437d7cd3fc60f6f", "roles" : [ "readWrite", "dbAdmin" ], "_id" : ObjectId("5489c22270d7fad1ba631dc3") } Replace ``CEILOMETER_DBPASS`` with a suitable password. .. note:: If the command fails saying you are not authorized to insert a user, you may need to temporarily comment out the ``auth`` option in the ``/etc/mongodb.conf`` file, restart the MongoDB service using ``service mongodb restart``, and try calling the command again. # apt-get install ceilometer-api ceilometer-collector \Configure the Apache HTTP server -------------------------------- #. Create the ``/etc/apache2/sites-available/ceilometer.conf`` file with the following content: .. code-block:: apache Listen 8777 <VirtualHost *:8777> WSGIDaemonProcess ceilometer-api processes=2 threads=10 user=ceilometer group=ceilometer display-name=%{GROUP} WSGIProcessGroup ceilometer-api WSGIScriptAlias / "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/ceilometer/api/app.wsgi" WSGIApplicationGroup %{GLOBAL} ErrorLog /var/log/apache2/ceilometer_error.log CustomLog /var/log/apache2/ceilometer_access.log combined </VirtualHost> WSGISocketPrefix /var/run/apache2 #. Enable the Telemetry service virtual hosts: .. code-block:: console # a2ensite ceilometer #. Reload the Apache HTTP server: .. code-block:: console # service apache2 reload

commit_message:
Hyper-V PCI Passthrough

Discrete Device Assignment is a new feature in Windows Server 2016,
offering users the possibility of taking some of the PCI Express
devices in their systems and pass them through directly to a guest VM.

Co-Authored-By: Claudiu Belu <cbelu@cloudbasesolutions.com>

Depends-On: I8e7782d3e1e9f8e92406604f05504a7754ffa3c2

Implements: blueprint hyper-v-pci-passthrough

Change-Id: Ica395a982da1ffa4ead41601124d192a838ea1ad

commit_message:
Return default for change list

If the task or role is skipped, ansible still tries to evaluate
variables and doesn't consider set_fact, having ansible change
list as undefined, which stops playbook with fatal error.

Change-Id: I7417918b26893fb37bed35260eee7cc98feaea9a

commit_message:
Fix Zaqar client auth

Using session instead of hardcoding credentials to avoid auth issue
when initializing Zaqar client.

commit_message:
Fix token expire wich may happen in using clients

Add a new way to create clients, which usees session and can solve the
bug that the token may expire during protecting works. Then we can create
client once and use it all the time(<48h) without worry that the token may
expire.

Change-Id: I8becc6db0b3624039eddaa373965b1ba85066606
Implements: blueprint refactor-clients
Partial-Bug: #1566793

commit_message:
Migrate testing to ostestr and adding docs

Following commits not only enables running
unit tests with ostestr, like other
OS projects, but also:
* enables covarage with testr
* enables building documentation with build_sphinx commands

Additionally:
* tox.ini was organized a bit
* (cherry picked commit 0db2f1cd2adeabe55089b94458f5b70d58f7d281)

Needed-By: Ie289f5ca3d82a3150a0d0f8b8284385efe6ae4b2
Change-Id: I8377c1a846d29854cff623b1abaa467df50fcc28
(cherry picked from commit 04030115dbc2ba986529d7bb5a8f4dcd1d497aca)

Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to clients is slightly more complex than
services as the clients themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove monasca-log-api.

Change-Id: Iac96425ce785890b1bd06fe00f5b666a6ecdbc61

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import os from proboscis import test from proboscis.asserts import assert_true from fuelweb_test.helpers.checkers import check_plugin_path_env from fuelweb_test.helpers import utils from fuelweb_test.helpers.decorators import log_snapshot_after_test from fuelweb_test import settings from fuelweb_test.tests.base_test_case import SetupEnvironment from fuelweb_test.tests.base_test_case import TestBasic @test(groups=["thread_separate_services_ceph"]) class SeparateKeystoneCeph(TestBasic): """SeparateKeystoneCeph""" # TODO documentation @test(depends_on=[SetupEnvironment.prepare_slaves_9], groups=["separate_keystone_ceph_service"]) @log_snapshot_after_test def separate_keystone_ceph_service(self): """Deployment with separate keystone nodes and ceph for all Scenario: 1. Install database and keystone plugins on the master node 2. Create Ubuntu, Neutron VXLAN, ceph for all storages cluster 3. Change ceph replication factor to 2 4. Add 3 nodes with controller role 5. Add 3 nodes with database+keystone role 6. Add 1 compute node 7. Add 2 ceph nodes 8. Run network verification 9. Deploy changes 10. Run network verification 11. Run OSTF tests Duration 120m Snapshot separate_keystone_ceph_service """ self.check_run("separate_keystone_ceph_service") check_plugin_path_env( var_name='SEPARATE_SERVICE_DB_PLUGIN_PATH', plugin_path=settings.SEPARATE_SERVICE_DB_PLUGIN_PATH ) check_plugin_path_env( var_name='SEPARATE_SERVICE_KEYSTONE_PLUGIN_PATH', plugin_path=settings.SEPARATE_SERVICE_KEYSTONE_PLUGIN_PATH ) self.env.revert_snapshot("ready_with_9_slaves") # copy plugins to the master node utils.upload_tarball( ip=self.ssh_manager.admin_ip, tar_path=settings.SEPARATE_SERVICE_DB_PLUGIN_PATH, tar_target="/var") utils.upload_tarball( ip=self.ssh_manager.admin_ip, tar_path=settings.SEPARATE_SERVICE_KEYSTONE_PLUGIN_PATH, tar_target="/var") # install plugins utils.install_plugin_check_code( ip=self.ssh_manager.admin_ip, plugin=os.path.basename( settings.SEPARATE_SERVICE_DB_PLUGIN_PATH)) utils.install_plugin_check_code( ip=self.ssh_manager.admin_ip, plugin=os.path.basename( settings.SEPARATE_SERVICE_KEYSTONE_PLUGIN_PATH)) data = { 'volumes_lvm': False, 'volumes_ceph': True, 'images_ceph': True, 'ephemeral_ceph': True, 'objects_ceph': True, 'osd_pool_size': '2', 'tenant': 'separatekeystoneceph', 'user': 'separatekeystoneceph', 'password': 'separatekeystoneceph', "net_provider": 'neutron', "net_segment_type": settings.NEUTRON_SEGMENT['tun'], } cluster_id = self.fuel_web.create_cluster( name=self.__class__.__name__, mode=settings.DEPLOYMENT_MODE, settings=data) plugin_names = ['detach-database', 'detach-keystone'] msg = "Plugin couldn't be enabled. Check plugin version. Test aborted" for plugin_name in plugin_names: assert_true( self.fuel_web.check_plugin_exists(cluster_id, plugin_name), msg) options = {'metadata/enabled': True} self.fuel_web.update_plugin_data(cluster_id, plugin_name, options) self.fuel_web.update_nodes( cluster_id, { 'slave-01': ['controller'], 'slave-02': ['controller'], 'slave-03': ['controller'], 'slave-04': ['standalone-database', 'standalone-keystone'], 'slave-05': ['standalone-database', 'standalone-keystone'], 'slave-06': ['standalone-database', 'standalone-keystone'], 'slave-07': ['compute'], 'slave-08': ['ceph-osd'], 'slave-09': ['ceph-osd'] } ) self.fuel_web.verify_network(cluster_id) # Cluster deploy self.fuel_web.deploy_cluster_wait(cluster_id) self.fuel_web.verify_network(cluster_id) self.fuel_web.run_ostf( cluster_id=cluster_id) self.env.make_snapshot("separate_keystone_ceph_service")

commit_message:
Skip grenade DependsOn references

We don't consume grenade, so we can skip any references to that repo
otherwise some patches fail (e.g nova experimental tripleo jobs)

Change-Id: Ie062cbd9902f7c91a62ecca622bec75762047d6d

subject: Correctly set project_name
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-30 07:52:18.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lib/context.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib/commit/dd1f390fe74eb461b95c1e0aa60ab14164b266bb', 'message': "Correctly set project_name

With newer keystone middleware tenant* isn't set, project* is. The
current neutron logic assumes tenant is the good values, and that
project should mirror it, but that logic actually needs to be
inverted.

In order to minimally impact unit tests as operations, the strategy
here is to just prefer project_name, but fall back to tenant_name if
project_name isn't filled out (this should basically never be the
case).

With this project_name shows up in the context log lines in devstack
again (it's been missing for some time).

This was done in neutron in commit af6b9b36c59f40e2e9bf3917816b032e062b93ef.

Change-Id: I1bf87ea24a48c9ca7a8655f0d7b921c1725a83c3
"}]
commit_message:
Correctly set project_name

With newer keystone middleware tenant* isn't set, project* is. The
current neutron logic assumes tenant is the good values, and that
project should mirror it, but that logic actually needs to be
inverted.

In order to minimally impact unit tests as operations, the strategy
here is to just prefer project_name, but fall back to tenant_name if
project_name isn't filled out (this should basically never be the
case).

With this project_name shows up in the context log lines in devstack
again (it's been missing for some time).

This was done in neutron in commit af6b9b36c59f40e2e9bf3917816b032e062b93ef.

Change-Id: I1bf87ea24a48c9ca7a8655f0d7b921c1725a83c3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib refs/changes/60/426660/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(sdague): tenant* is a deprecated set of names from # keystone, and is no longer set in modern keystone middleware # code, as such this is almost always going to be None. # prefer project_name, as that's what's going to be set by # keystone. Fall back if for some reason it's blank. 'tenant_name': self.project_name or self.tenant_name, 'project_name': self.project_name or self.tenant_name, # prefer project_name, as that's what's going to be set by # keystone. Fall back if for some reason it's blank. values['tenant_name'] = self.project_name or self.tenant_name values['project_name'] = self.project_name or self.tenant_name
deleted_lines: 'tenant_name': self.tenant_name, 'project_name': self.tenant_name, values['tenant_name'] = self.tenant_name values['project_name'] = self.tenant_name

Our VolumeType versioned object normally expects projects attribute to

Change-Id: I14c6a441bb800a8b1d855e19bfb11bd6ed1266c9
Closes-Bug: 1659013

commit_message:
Eager load projects when getting types by group

Our VolumeType versioned object normally expects projects attribute to
be present in DB object. This commit makes sure it is loaded on the DB
side to prevent DetachedInstanceError when using
volume_type_get_all_by_group.

Change-Id: I14c6a441bb800a8b1d855e19bfb11bd6ed1266c9
Closes-Bug: 1659013

"}]
commit_message:
Always acquire network.id lock in dhcp port update

Looking at the cache before aqcuiring a lock may cause the
agent to mistakenly think the network doesn't exist when it
is actually being wired in parallel.

Always acquiring the network-based semaphore will ensure that
the network isn't currently being setup in another coroutine.

Closes-Bug: #1659919
Change-Id: I99ae71e3c5b1cd91dca3f6c80b04d2ecb79de64f

commit_message:
Use admin credentials when available

The admin token is only intended to be used to bootstrap
a keystone server and it is preferred to use the admin
credentials for other admin operations. Some operations
are even expected to fail with the admin-token.

This patch checks if admin credentials have been generated
and use them if them if possible. Credentials are also
regularly validated by doing an initial token request to
keystone.

Closes-Bug: #1642979
Change-Id: I9102e2fb3631a6db7d9a2b0417bb91cabc878693

added_lines: from keystoneclient.auth.identity import v3from charmhelpers.core.hookenv import DEBUG, logdef _get_keystone_manager_class(endpoint, token, api_version, username=None, password=None, domain_id=None, project_name=None): @param username: username @param password: password @param domain_id: domain's ID @param project_name: project name return KeystoneManager3(endpoint, token, username, password, domain_id, project_name)def get_keystone_manager(endpoint, token, api_version=None, username=None, password=None, domain_id=None, project_name=None): @param username: username @param password: password @param domain_id: domain's ID @param project_name: project name return _get_keystone_manager_class(endpoint, token, api_version, username, password, domain_id, project_name) manager = _get_keystone_manager_class(endpoint, token, 3, username, password, domain_id, project_name) return _get_keystone_manager_class(new_ep, token, 3, username, password, domain_id, project_name) def __init__(self, endpoint, token, username=None, password=None, domain_id=None, project_name=None): if username and password and domain_id and project_name: # The information needed was already generated, it may still not # be usable (e.g. pending grants, password not set in the DB, etc) # In case keystone rejects the "list users" operation for any # reason we fall back to the admin token. keystone_auth_v3 = v3.Password(auth_url=endpoint, username=username, password=password, project_name=project_name, user_domain_id=domain_id, project_domain_id=domain_id) try: log("Attempting to use 'password' authentication method", level=DEBUG) keystone_session_v3 = session.Session(auth=keystone_auth_v3) client = keystoneclient_v3.Client(session=keystone_session_v3) client.users.list() log('user/pass worked') except Exception as ex: # The user/password credentials aren't functional yet # we fallback to the admin-token log('Exception: %s' % str(ex), level='DEBUG') log('falling back to admin token', level='DEBUG') keystone_auth_v3 = token_endpoint.Token(endpoint=endpoint, token=token) else: log("using admin token") keystone_auth_v3 = token_endpoint.Token(endpoint=endpoint, token=token)

commit_message:
Add developer docs

This patch adds developer documentation in the docs/ directory.  The
documentation is written using sphinx.  We also include an npm command
to build the documentation (ie npm run docs).

Closes-bug: 1651106
Change-Id: Ifcce40e1727ddb5eb7cac8586cb41d6f2a3e78d0

added_lines: See [testing](docs/testing.md)See [translation](docs/translation.md)
deleted_lines: ## Single test run - `npm test` (alternatively run `karma start --single-run`) - `npm run lint` to run ESLint Info on Linting setup: https://medium.com/@dan_abramov/lint-like-it-s-2015-6987d44c5b48 .eslintrc rules tweaks: http://blog.javascripting.com/2015/09/07/fine-tuning-airbnbs-eslint-config/ ## Tests during development Start Karma to run tests after every change ```npm run test:watch``` ## Debugging tests 1. option: - use `console.log` in the test and see the output in karma server output 2. option: - install karma-chrome-launcher npm module `npm install karma-chrome-launcher --save-dev` - replace/add 'Chrome' to browsers in `karma.conf.js` - now Karma will launch Chrome to run the tests - use `debugger;` statement in test code to add breakpoints - in Karma Chrome window click 'debug' button and debug in chrome developer tools as usual - optionally you can use karma-jasmine-html-reporter for better test output (https://www.npmjs.com/package/karma-jasmine-html-reporter) - make sure you don't push those changes to `karma.conf.js` and `package.json` as part of your patch tripleo-ui uses the react-intl package for translation. ## Adding translateable strings Strings are prepared for translation using react-intl's `defineMessages` API. Check out `./src/js/components/deployment_plan/` for examples. ## Extracting messages from components Messages are extracted during the build process (`npm run build`) and stored in the `./i18n/extracted-messages/` folder. These files can be converted into a single `.pot` file with this command: ``` npm run json2pot ``` The resulting file (`./messages.pot`) can be uploaded to http://zanata.org to create/update the translation. ## Using translated `.po` files The translated language file (`messages.po`) then needs to be converted into one JSON file per language (Japanese in this example): ``` npm run po2json -- messages.po -o ./i18n/locales/ja.json ``` ## Adding a new language The languages are defined in the ./src/js/components/i18n/I18NProvider component. To add another language, import the relevant locale data from the react-intl packages, as well as the JSON containing the translation and add the new language to the MESSAGES constant: ``` import ja from 'react-intl/locale-data/ja'; import jaMessages from '../../../../i18n/locales/ja.json'; const MESSAGES = { ja: jaMessages.messages }; ```

commit_message:
[admin-guide] move default ports from config ref

Firewalls and default ports configuration is an administrative
tasks, and not OpenStack configuration options.
Also, we usually don't change the ports.

Change-Id: I0b5f488e8dfb89ce3bac52988e36768e765a01e3

commit_message:
Remove shared checkbox for non-admin users when doing network things.

Non-admin users are not allowed to touch the 'shared' checkbox when
creating or updating networks. It is better to make this invisible
to non-admin users instead of presenting it but not allowed to touch.

Change-Id: Ia5ed186b22f8658866c3a2b2acdde8053d176d81
Closes-Bug: #1651626

commit_message:
Search bug links in testrail only in N days before

For now there is over 200 requests in batch of 5 test runs iterating over all
created testplans, even older than half of year. Its absolutely not required
and testrail allow us to iterate through testplans created after date X.
We can use this feature and reduce time spent on useless get requests.

This patch introduces new variable TESTRAIL_DAYS_TO_ANALYZE that allow
us not to go too deep into testrail history. For now the default is 14 days.
It decreases uploading time from 20 minutes to 30-60 seconds and also reduces
load of testrail.

Change-Id: I468b14f6c5d6f8472b78980e3798f306068d3df2
(cherry picked from commit 2596c8d7960646ea204e3a67c2570bfbf8eeafe3)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-25 20:37:33.000000000', 'files': ['networking_generic_switch/tests/unit/test_generic_switch_mech.py', 'networking_generic_switch/generic_switch_mech.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-generic-switch/commit/c246e24404af0564ffaa1aa975771d7ad39280bc', 'message': "Fix bound port left in DOWN state

This patch fixes an issue when we bound a port later than DHCP.
In this case provisioning is completed before port become bound and
it is not moved to ACTIVE state. When port is actually bound it is
not trigger port status update.
This patch adds new provisionig block 'GENERICSWITCH' before start
actual port binding, and complete provisioning for this block

Change-Id: I1b2adcabb8edae04785e4723bdec02a54cd7315f
"}]
commit_message:
Fix bound port left in DOWN state

This patch fixes an issue when we bound a port later than DHCP.
In this case provisioning is completed before port become bound and
it is not moved to ACTIVE state. When port is actually bound it is
not trigger port status update.
This patch adds new provisionig block 'GENERICSWITCH' before start
actual port binding, and complete provisioning for this block
in update_port_postcommit when port is in bound state it allows to
move it to ACTIVE.

Change-Id: I1b2adcabb8edae04785e4723bdec02a54cd7315f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-generic-switch refs/changes/02/425402/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Use Request.path instead of rebuilding path from elements

In some logging, we create request path from account, container,
and object name, but it is inefficient because because we can get
whole request path as self.request.path.
This patch removes these path rebuilding.

NOTE:
This patch also removes some redundant log messages in swift
middleware.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I0f0771cf382369f37dc6a1248bd220f3b0ae83ec

commit_message:
Delete the presence of default flavors

There are not any default flavors after the commit
"Remove flavor seeding from the base migration" which
removes default flavors from the database, that means
the new deploys will not have them(m1.tiny, m1.small,
m1.medium, m1.large, m1.xlarge).

Change-Id: Ifcdd6f1500a937de8dfd9d265bd5ee3406cb70e0
Closes-Bug: #1567009

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-26 19:03:25.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/solidfire.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/solidfire/test_solidfire.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/cc325cb3f64e7453db686148132037f50a3628c0', 'message': 'Zero out SolidFire capacity when unreachable

If for some reason connectivity to the cluster goes down, we just return the
cached capacity info.  Then the scheduler still sees the cluster as an
available resource in the pool.

This change detects connectivity issues during the get_cluster_stats call and
if the call fails, we report 0 available capacity to keep create calls from

Closes-Bug: #1398877
'}]
commit_message:
Zero out SolidFire capacity when unreachable

If for some reason connectivity to the cluster goes down, we just return the
cached capacity info.  Then the scheduler still sees the cluster as an
available resource in the pool.

This change detects connectivity issues during the get_cluster_stats call and
if the call fails, we report 0 available capacity to keep create calls from
being scheduled to the cluster.

Change-Id: I3f730e140c2b61fdd407c90b134916108312278a
Closes-Bug: #1398877

iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys

commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I2b2c1e76c4dda9a106ff3783fe882fb8a0f78112

commit_message:
libvirt: add event lifecycle details

This commit adds event lifecycle log detail. Currently only libvirt is
reporting such details but other drivers can implement them.

Change-Id: Ic1fa66fff09c45cd3e9b84f7456cda7d0d9fed9e

commit_message:
virt: remove small pages request

Since small pages are the default page size it is not
necessary to explicity request for using that size.

Change-Id: I7137667d562a35c23d6c7842ef1e3408b1f73ee2
Related-Bug: #1439247
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/79/172079/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if inst_cell.pagesize == MEMPAGES_LARGE: if instance_cell.pagesize and instance_cell.pagesize != MEMPAGES_SMALL: # NOTE(sahid): The condition "instance_cell.pagesize != MEMPAGES_SMALL" # if for backward compatibility with instance that explicity request # to use small pages. Can be removed for M*.
deleted_lines: if inst_cell.pagesize == MEMPAGES_SMALL: return verify_pagesizes(host_cell, inst_cell, avail_pagesize[-1:]) elif inst_cell.pagesize == MEMPAGES_LARGE: if instance_cell.pagesize: elif request == "small": return MEMPAGES_SMALL

commit_message:
Replaced e.message with str(e)

For logging the exception message: e.message has been
deprecated. The preferred way is to call str(e).
more details:
https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0352/

Change-Id: Id71b54ab87ce084d499421fea62b58b6b9f4aeb2

added_lines: log.warning("unexpected error: %s", str(e))

commit_message:
Replaced e.message with str(e)

For logging the exception message: e.message has been
deprecated. The preferred way is to call str(e).
More details: https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0352/

Change-Id: I78cd4f52eece8c5f469131e21a7f897d1fd24dd3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-menu refs/changes/45/420545/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: log.exception(str(e))

commit_message:
H802 hacking have been deprecated

H802 hacking have been removed since hacking 0.10.
https://github.com/openstack-dev/hacking/blob/master/setup.cfg
Closes-Bug: #1653849

Change-Id: Ie1db82b3e5904a70ad1fb311d50df68a2352fc62

commit_message:
Add mountable snapshots support

This new feature gives the user the ability to allow and
deny access to the snapshots, so that they could be mounted in
read-only mode to retrieve files.

APIImpact
DocImpact

Co-Authored-By: Rodrigo Barbieri <rodrigo.barbieri@fit-tecnologia.org.br>
Co-Authored-By: Alyson Rosa <alyson.rosa@fit-tecnologia.org.br>
Co-Authored-By: Miriam Yumi <miriam.peixoto@fit-tecnologia.org.br>

Partially-implements: blueprint manila-mountable-snapshots
Change-Id: I65f398a05f82eef31ec317d70dfa101483b44b30

added_lines: RPC_API_VERSION = '1.12' snapshot_export_location = model_update.pop('export_location', None) if snapshot_export_location is not None: values = { 'share_snapshot_instance_id': snapshot_instance_id, 'path': snapshot_export_location, } self.db.share_snapshot_instance_export_location_create(context, values) rules = self.db.share_snapshot_access_get_all_for_share_snapshot( context, snapshot_instance['snapshot_id']) for rule in rules: self.snapshot_deny_access(context, snapshot_instance_id, rule['id']) try: el = self.db.share_snapshot_instance_export_location_get( context, snapshot_instance_id) self.db.share_snapshot_instance_export_location_delete(context, el['id']) except exception.NotFound: LOG.info(_LI("Snapshot does not have export location. Moving on.")) def snapshot_allow_access(self, context, snapshot_instance_id, access_id): snapshot_instance = self.db.share_snapshot_instance_get( context, snapshot_instance_id) access = self.db.share_snapshot_access_get(context, access_id) mapping = self.db.share_snapshot_instance_access_get( context, snapshot_instance['id'], access['id']) try: self.driver.snapshot_allow_access(context, snapshot_instance, access) self.db.share_snapshot_instance_access_update_state( context, mapping['id'], constants.STATUS_ACTIVE) except Exception: self.db.share_snapshot_instance_access_update_state( context, mapping['id'], constants.STATUS_ERROR) def snapshot_deny_access(self, context, snapshot_instance_id, access_id): snapshot_instance = self.db.share_snapshot_instance_get( context, snapshot_instance_id) access = self.db.share_snapshot_access_get(context, access_id) mapping = self.db.share_snapshot_instance_access_get( context, snapshot_instance['id'], access['id']) try: self.driver.snapshot_deny_access(context, snapshot_instance, access) self.db.share_snapshot_instance_access_delete(context, mapping['id']) except Exception: self.db.share_snapshot_instance_access_update_state( context, mapping['id'], constants.STATUS_ERROR)

commit_message:
Search bug links in testrail only in N days before

For now there is over 200 requests in batch of 5 test runs iterating over all
created testplans, even older than half of year. Its absolutely not required
and testrail allow us to iterate through testplans created after date X.
We can use this feature and reduce time spent on useless get requests.

This patch introduces new variable TESTRAIL_DAYS_TO_ANALYZE that allow
us not to go too deep into testrail history. For now the default is 14 days.
It decreases uploading time from 20 minutes to 30-60 seconds and also reduces
load of testrail.

Change-Id: I468b14f6c5d6f8472b78980e3798f306068d3df2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/89/426189/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: limit=TestRailSettings.previous_results_depth, created_after=TestRailSettings.previous_results_days_to_analyze)

commit_message:
Adds Hyper-V PCI Passthrough support

Discrete Device Assignment is a new feature in Windows Server 2016,
offering users the possibility of taking some of the PCI Express
devices in their systems and pass them through directly to a guest VM.

Adds a method in hostutils which retrieves the list of PCI devices
which can be be assigned to VMs.

Adds methods for attaching / detaching a PCI device to / from a VM
in vmutils.

Co-Authored-By: Claudiu Belu <cbelu@cloudbasesolutions.com>

Change-Id: I8e7782d3e1e9f8e92406604f05504a7754ffa3c2
Implements: blueprint os-win-pci-passthrough

commit_message:
Lock table and sync rule before each rule insert

In replicated PE mode, lock table and sync rule before each rule
insert to prevent conflicting rule from being inserted from another
policy engine.

Supported backends are MySQL and PostgreSQL
Manually tested with both backends.

TODO: add tempest scenarios to test recursion blocked
https://bugs.launchpad.net/congress/+bug/1655787

Closes-Bug: 1638746
Closes-Bug: 1637185

Change-Id: I29c6f63b467905c26fe1d35348a3b7a70d8414b6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/congress refs/changes/77/416777/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from congress.db import api as db_api try: # get session db_session = db_api.get_session(make_new=True) db_session.begin(subtransactions=False) if cfg.CONF.replicated_policy_engine: # lock rules table to prevent conflicting rules insertion # (say causing unsupported recursion) # supported DBs are SQLite and MySQL and Postgres if db_api.is_mysql(): # Explicitly LOCK TABLES for MySQL db_session.execute('LOCK TABLES policies WRITE') if db_api.is_postgres(): # Explicitly LOCK TABLE for Postgres db_session.execute('LOCK TABLE policies IN EXCLUSIVE MODE') # Do nothing for SQLite; DB auto locked for transaction # synchronize policy rules self.synchronize_rules() # Reject rules inserted into non-persisted policies # (i.e. datasource policies) # Note(thread-safety): blocking call policy_name = db_policy_rules.policy_name(policy_name) # call synchronizer to make sure policy is synchronized in memory self.synchronize_policies(policy_name=policy_name) # Note(thread-safety): blocking call policies = db_policy_rules.get_policies() persisted_policies = set([p.name for p in policies]) if policy_name not in persisted_policies: if policy_name in self.theory: LOG.debug( "insert_persisted_rule error: rule not permitted for " "policy %s", policy_name) raise exception.PolicyRuntimeException( name='rule_not_permitted') id_ = uuidutils.generate_uuid() try: rule = self.parse(str_rule) except exception.PolicyException as e: # TODO(thinrichs): change compiler to provide these error_code # names directly. raise exception.PolicyException(str(e), name='rule_syntax') if len(rule) == 1: rule = rule[0] else: msg = ("Received multiple rules: " + "; ".join(str(x) for x in rule)) raise exception.PolicyRuntimeException( msg, name='multiple_rules') rule.set_id(id_) rule.set_name(rule_name) rule.set_comment(comment or "") rule.set_original_str(str_rule) changes = self._safe_process_policy_update( rule, policy_name, persistent=True) # save rule to database if change actually happened. # Note: change produced may not be equivalent to original rule # because of column-reference elimination. if len(changes) > 0: d = {'rule': rule.pretty_str(), 'id': str(rule.id), 'comment': rule.comment, 'name': rule.name} try: # Note(thread-safety): blocking call db_policy_rules.add_policy_rule( d['id'], policy_name, str_rule, d['comment'], rule_name=d['name'], session=db_session) return (d['id'], d) except Exception as db_exception: try: self._safe_process_policy_update( rule, policy_name, insert=False) raise exception.PolicyRuntimeException( "Error while writing to DB: %s." % str(db_exception)) except Exception as change_exception: raise exception.PolicyRuntimeException( "Error thrown during recovery from DB error. " "Inconsistent state. DB error: %s. " "New error: %s." % (str(db_exception), str(change_exception))) # change not accepted means it was already there raise exception.PolicyRuntimeException( name='rule_already_exists') finally: # unlock table if db_session: if db_api.is_mysql(): db_session.execute('UNLOCK TABLES') # postgres automatically releases lock after transaction completes db_session.close()
deleted_lines: # Reject rules inserted into non-persisted policies # (i.e. datasource policies) # Note(thread-safety): blocking call policy_name = db_policy_rules.policy_name(policy_name) # call synchronizer to make sure policy is synchronized in memory self.synchronize_policies(policy_name=policy_name) # Note(thread-safety): blocking call policies = db_policy_rules.get_policies() persisted_policies = set([p.name for p in policies]) if policy_name not in persisted_policies: if policy_name in self.theory: LOG.debug( "insert_persisted_rule error: rule not permitted for " "policy %s", policy_name) raise exception.PolicyRuntimeException( name='rule_not_permitted') id_ = uuidutils.generate_uuid() try: rule = self.parse(str_rule) except exception.PolicyException as e: # TODO(thinrichs): change compiler to provide these error_code # names directly. raise exception.PolicyException(str(e), name='rule_syntax') if len(rule) == 1: rule = rule[0] else: msg = ("Received multiple rules: " + "; ".join(str(x) for x in rule)) raise exception.PolicyRuntimeException(msg, name='multiple_rules') rule.set_id(id_) rule.set_name(rule_name) rule.set_comment(comment or "") rule.set_original_str(str_rule) changes = self._safe_process_policy_update( rule, policy_name, persistent=True) # save rule to database if change actually happened. # Note: change produced may not be equivalent to original rule because # of column-reference elimination. if len(changes) > 0: d = {'rule': rule.pretty_str(), 'id': str(rule.id), 'comment': rule.comment, 'name': rule.name} try: # Note(thread-safety): blocking call db_policy_rules.add_policy_rule( d['id'], policy_name, str_rule, d['comment'], rule_name=d['name']) return (d['id'], d) except Exception as db_exception: try: self._safe_process_policy_update( rule, policy_name, insert=False) raise exception.PolicyRuntimeException( "Error while writing to DB: %s." % str(db_exception)) except Exception as change_exception: raise exception.PolicyRuntimeException( "Error thrown during recovery from DB error. " "Inconsistent state. DB error: %s. " "New error: %s." % (str(db_exception), str(change_exception))) # change not accepted means it was already there raise exception.PolicyRuntimeException( name='rule_already_exists')

commit_message:
Add experimental build job for manila-test-image

Manila-test-image has no real gate jobs to speak of. This change
adds a real test job that runs the build, but as experimental
while we test that it works.

commit_message:
Refact Orchestrator

Add check_time_state in utils since both Orchestrator
and Worker has used. Get wait_time and period from cfg
and put them in first place.

Change-Id: Id04ab21dc68a2b4d0ced28354e7ddfb32160b850

subject: Remove 'X-Static-Large-Object' from .meta files
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-12 11:45:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/b44140052a55c777c3a3b95d2faadc1727458686', 'message': "Remove 'X-Static-Large-Object' from .meta files

In current implementation, object-server copies 'X-Static-Large-Object'
from .data files of slo manifest objects to .meta files when users make
request of fast-POST. However, it will cause a problem in split brain case
as follows:

State1: An user PUT manifest object with t0 timestamp.

State2: Split brain happens.
    +--------------+--------------+
    |    brain1    |    brain2    |
    +--------------+--------------+
    | manifest(t0) | manifest(t0) |
    +--------------+--------------+

State3: An user PUT a new object which is not manifest
        in brain1 with t1 timestamp.
    +--------------+--------------+
    |    brain1    |    brain2    |
    +--------------+--------------+
    |  new_obj(t1) | manifest(t0) |
    +--------------+--------------+

State4: An user POST to the manifest in brain2 with t2 timestamp.
        In this case, the .meta file will have 'X-Static-Large-Object'
    +--------------+--------------+
    |    brain1    |    brain2    |
    +--------------+--------------+
    |  new_obj(t1) | manifest(t0) |
    |              |   .meta(t2)  |
    +--------------+--------------+

State5: Split brain is solved. The new object has 'X-Static-Large-Object'
        nevertheless it is not manifest object.
    +-----------------------------+
    |         merged brain        |
    +-----------------------------+
    |          new_obj(t1)        |
    |           .meta(t2)         |
    +-----------------------------+

This patch changes handling of 'X-Static-Large-Object',
'X-Static-Large-Object' will be read from .data file.

Change-Id: Ic4ec0850b320907c52f6bc68f5588b3930d03c3d

    +-----------------------------+

This patch changes handling of 'X-Static-Large-Object' metadata, and
fixes this bug.

Change-Id: Ic4ec0850b320907c52f6bc68f5588b3930d03c3d
Related-Bug:#1634723

commit_message:
Remove 'X-Static-Large-Object' from .meta files

In current implementation, object-server copies 'X-Static-Large-Object'
from .data files of slo manifest objects to .meta files when users make
request of fast-POST. However, it will cause a problem in split brain
case as follows:

State1: An user PUT manifest object with t0 timestamp.

State2: Split brain happens.
    +--------------+--------------+
    |    brain1    |    brain2    |
    +--------------+--------------+
    | manifest(t0) | manifest(t0) |
    +--------------+--------------+

State3: An user PUT a new object which is not manifest
        in brain1 with t1 timestamp.
    +--------------+--------------+
    |    brain1    |    brain2    |
    +--------------+--------------+
    |  new_obj(t1) | manifest(t0) |
    +--------------+--------------+

State4: An user POST to the manifest in brain2 with t2 timestamp.
        In this case, the .meta file will have 'X-Static-Large-Object'
    +--------------+--------------+
    |    brain1    |    brain2    |
    +--------------+--------------+
    |  new_obj(t1) | manifest(t0) |
    |              |   .meta(t2)  |
    +--------------+--------------+

State5: Split brain is solved. The new object has
        'X-Static-Large-Object' nevertheless it is not manifest object.
    +-----------------------------+
    |         merged brain        |
    +-----------------------------+
    |          new_obj(t1)        |
    |           .meta(t2)         |
    +-----------------------------+

This patch changes handling of 'X-Static-Large-Object' metadata, and
fixes this bug.

Change-Id: Ic4ec0850b320907c52f6bc68f5588b3930d03c3d
Closes-Bug:#1634723

commit_message:
Add i18n translation to extensions 3/3

This is patch 3 of 3 that aims to add i18n translation to the
extenstions directory and some other files.

Custom hacking rules will come later to enforce this style.

Change-Id: I94a341ba1fb4178e0c358c37ea31623d48938ec6
Depends-On: I6fb2bdcc4b83457e08b24599fb4a297ef6ec6c14

commit_message:
Add new Magnum resources

Magnum resources Bay and Baymodel is now renamed to Cluster and
ClusterTemplate respectively and which is deprecated. So this patch
implements new Magnum Resources: Cluster and ClusterTemplate.
We can remove the old resources from heat when the support for
those resources is completely removed from Magnum.

Change-Id: I03379000350fde342cc7f6014d194a6438d6bdb5
TBD: Update the documents to add this new resources.
